upstream_interp¶

profitroll.methods.upstream_interp.upstream_interp(alpha_x, alpha_y, F, method='linear', verbose=0, ho=0.15, **kwargs)¶

upstream_interp interpolates a multidimensionnal field F from a 2D grid to an ‘upstream’ unstructured mesh defined by the displacements alpha_x, alpha_y. If F were a continuous field, we would have: F_int(x,y) = F(x-alpha, y-alpha)

Parameters

  • alpha_x (ndarray) – a two dimensional field of displacement along the first dimension

  • alpha_y (ndarray) – a two dimensional field of displacement along the second dimension

  • F (ndarray) – 2D-Field to be advected. A vectorial field can be advected (the X and Y dimension should come second and third)

  • method (string, optional) – method used for the interpolation: ‘nearest’, ‘linear’, or ‘bicubic’. Defaults to ‘linear’

  • verbose (int, optional) – a scalar between 0 and 2. The higher the number, the more prints. Defaults to 0

  • ho (int, optional) – Distance around grid points where additional diffusion is added with the ‘damping’ method. Defaults to 0.15.

Raises

"Unknown method for interpolation" – Invalid string as a method for interpolation

Returns

F_int: Advected field.

Return type

ndarray

profitroll.methods.wrap_advection_step_3P.wrap_advection_step_3P(history, grid, params, alpha_method, order_alpha, F_method, verbose=0, **kwargs)¶

  • grid (Grid object) – Spatial grid of the simulation

  • params (dictionary) – Dictionary of usefull parameters

  • alpha_method (str) – see advection_step_3P

  • order_alpha (int) – see advection_step_3P

  • F_method (str) – see advection_step_3P

  • verbose (int, optional) – verbose, defaults to 0
